column1: -Chinese- Wā! Dǎ dé hǎo! (Wow! What a shot!)
-Chinese- Zhège shìjiè xūyào wǒmen. (The world needs us)
-Korean- Nal ra gan da. (I'm flying toward you.)

column2: Oh dragon who dwells in me!

column3: literal: "I hear one thing, from which I learn 10,000 things"

column2: Eat the sword of the dragon!

column5: Is that all you can do?

column4: -Japanese- Mi wo sutete mo, myōri wa sutezu.
column5: Even if I sacrifice my body, I will never sacrifice my honour

column4: -Japanese- Ryuu ga waga teki wo kurae!
column5: Let the Dragon consume my enemies.

column4:
-Russian- Byt’ možet, u čeloveka sto čuvstv i so smert’ju pogibaet tol’ko pjat’, izvestnyh nam. Ostal’nye devjanosto pjat’ ostajutsja živy. (Maybe, in fact, a human has hundred senses and with his death only five, known to us, will die. The other ninety five stay alive.)

-German- Nein."

column1: -German- Noch ein patient für meinen OP-Tisch.
column2: Another patient for my operating table.

column1: -German- Bitte nennen Sie die Art des medizinischen Notfalls.
column2: Please state the nature of the medical emergency
